author: fitz
msg: Patch by Mo DeJong  <mdejong@redhat.com>, reviewed and applied as is.
Removed a block in main that was adding a "." argument if the command
type is one of the commands that takes an implicit dot. This seems to
be a bad idea since the main() function needs to know about every
possible command and it is easy to miss one. For example, the diff
command is not included in this list.  It really should be, `svn diff`
should really work the same as `cvs diff`. It seems like a much better
solution would be to do this implicit dot check inside the functions
that actually need to do it.
Add header for new method defined in main.c.
prone block of code to push implicit dot target

author: sussman
msg: Begin rewrite of filesystem commit-editor, using svn_fs.h interface
instead of the dag.h layer.  Woohoo!
(struct edit_baton):  reorder args by hierarchy for readability.
(struct dir_baton):  remove dag_node_t, add absolute path, simplify.
(struct file_baton): remove dag_node_t, add absolute path, simplify.
remove all these things. We don't "do" db txns at this level.
fails.  call svn_fs_change_rev_prop to set log message.  (see code
comments on both of these changes.)
* svn_types.h (SVN_PROP_REVISION_LOG):  our very first reserved prop name. :)
